circuit
Class ParseSchem

java.lang.Object
  circuit.ParseSchem

public class ParseSchem
extends java.lang.Object

ParseSchem.java v.2.5 

   A FIDOCAD schematics draw class.


   Version History 

Version   Date           Author       Remarks
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1.0     March 2007      D. Bucci    First working version
1.1     December 2007   D. Bucci    Improved PCB rendering:
                                     - Pad dimensions and style
                                     - Drill
                                     - Mirrored text and size handling
1.2     December 2007   D. Bucci    Improved speed
                                    Supports layer
1.3     December 2007   D. Bucci    Better text rendering
                                    Improved speed
1.3.1   December 2007   D. Bucci    coordSys becomes private
                                    Provided methods to obtain zoom settings
                                    Provided methods to obtain circuit surface
                                    Improved speed by optimized redrawing
                                    Uses the new high resolution coordinates
                                    Improved layer handling
1.3.2   January 2008    D. Bucci    Handle PCB library macros
2.0     May 2008        D. Bucci    Redesigned primitive handling
2.1             June 2008               D. Bucci        Drag & drop 
2.2     August 2008             D. Bucci        
2.3     November 2008   D. Bucci    library becomes a TreeMap
2.4             December 2008   D. Bucci        FCJ extensions
2.5             June 2009               D. Bucci        Capitalize the first letters                                     
2.6             October 2009    D. Bucci        New FCJ extensions



   Written by Davide Bucci, March 2007 - June 2009, davbucci at tiscali dot it

public void loadLibraryDirectory(java.lang.String s)
Try to load all libraries ("*.fcl") files in the given directory. FCDstdlib.fcl if exists will be considered as standard library.

Parameters:
s - the directory in which the libraries should be present.

Parameters:
G - the graphic context to be used
xmin - the x (screen) coordinate of the upper left corner
ymin - the y (screen) coordinate of the upper left corner
xmax - the x (screen) coordinate of the bottom right corner
ymax - the y (screen) coordinate of the bottom right corner

selectPrimitive

public boolean selectPrimitive(int px,
                               int py,
                               int tolerance,
                               boolean toggle)
Select primitives close to the given point. Every parameter is given in logical coordinates.

Parameters:
px - the x coordinate of the given point.
py - the y coordinate of the given point.
tolerance - tolerance for the selection.
toggle - select always if false, toggle selection on/off if true
Returns:
true if a primitive has been selected.

rotateAllSelected

public void rotateAllSelected()
Rotate all selected primitives.

moveAllSelected

public void moveAllSelected(int dx,
                            int dy)
Move all selected primitives.

Parameters:
dx - relative x movement
dy - relative y movement

mirrorAllSelected

public void mirrorAllSelected()
Mirror all selected primitives.

selectRect

public boolean selectRect(int px,
                          int py,
                          int w,
                          int h)
Select primitives in a rectangular region (given in logical coordinates)

Parameters:
px - the x coordinate of the top left point.
py - the y coordinate of the top left point.
w - the width of the region
h - the height of the region
Returns:
true if at least a primitive has been selected

dragHandleStart

public void dragHandleStart(int px,
                            int py,
                            int tolerance,
                            boolean multiple)
Start dragging handle. Check if the pointer is on the handle of a primitive and if it is the case, enter the dragging state.

Parameters:
px - the (screen) x coordinate of the pointer
py - the (screen) y coordinate of the pointer
tolerance - the tolerance (screen. i.e. no of pixel)
multiple - specifies whether multiple selection is active

dragHandleEnd

public void dragHandleEnd(CircuitPanel P,
                          int px,
                          int py,
                          boolean multiple)
End dragging handle.

Parameters:
px - the (screen) x coordinate of the pointer
py - the (screen) y coordinate of the pointer
multiple - specifies whether multiple selection is active

dragHandleDrag

public void dragHandleDrag(CircuitPanel P,
                           java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                           int px,
                           int py)
Drag an handle.

Parameters:
g - the graphic context. It hould be in the XOR mode.
px - the (screen) x coordinate of the pointer
py - the (screen) y coordinate of the pointer

dragPrimitives

public void dragPrimitives(CircuitPanel P,
                           java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                           int px,
                           int py)
Drag all the selected primitives during a drag operation. Position the primitives in the given (screen) position

Parameters:
g - the graphic context
px - the x position (screen coordinates)
py - the y position (screen coordinates)

distancePrimitive

public int distancePrimitive(int px,
                             int py)
Calculates the minimum distance between the given point and a set of primitive. Every coordinate is logical.

Parameters:
px - the x coordinate of the given point.
py - the y coordinate of the given point.
Returns:
the distance in logical units.

parseString

public void parseString(java.lang.StringBuffer s)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Parse the circuit contained in the StringBuffer specified. This function resets the primitive database and then parses the circuit.

Parameters:
s - the string containing the circuit
Throws:
java.io.IOException

addString

public void addString(java.lang.StringBuffer s,
                      boolean selectNew)
               throws java.io.IOException
Parse the circuit contained in the StringBuffer specified. this funcion add the circuit to the current primitive database.

Parameters:
s - the string containing the circuit
selectNew - specify that the added primitives should be selected.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

exp - the selected exporting interface

java.io.IOException
